page.title: 14BIRDS
page.content: Kilchrenan is a good place for bird spotting. Since the second of march I Have seen 75 different kinds of birds. Some I have never seen before in my life, like the spotted- flycatcher, and the redwing. The spotted flycatcher is a small brownish bird with dark brown speckles on its breast. When the redwing settles you can see a red blob under its wings. I have only seen 4 different birds of prey this year, the kestrel, the merlin, the buzzard and the sparrow- hawk. Both merlin and kestrel hover to spot their prey, the buzzard perches on telegraph poles or trees to spot its prey and the sparrow-hawk swoops on its prey. Last year I saw the hen-harrier, the the golden eagle and the peregrine falcon.
